summary: osteosarcoma (OS) is a highly aggressive bone malignancy. the 5-year survival rate of primary OS is 65%. however, OS has a substantially poorer prognosis when associated with fatal lung metastases. mMP-11 is a member of the MMP family that have important roles in tumor invasion and metastasis. previous studies have shown that MMP-11 is associated with pathogenesis of various types of cancer. cDNA was synthesized using the RevertAid First Strand cDNA kit (Thermo Fisher Scientific, Inc.) RT-qPCR was performed using SYBR-Green Premix Ex Taq (Takara Bio, Inc.) human osteoblast hFOB1.19 cells were cultured in modified Eagle's medium. they were supplemented with 10% FBS (Gibco; Thermo Fisher Scientific, Inc.), 100 U/ml penicillin and 100 g/ml streptomycin at 37°C in a 5% CO2 humidified atmosphere. the cells from each group were seeded into 96-well plates at a total density of 2106 cells/well. on the following day, absorbance values were measured at 415 nm. the cells from each group were collected 36-h post-transfection and resuspended in medium at 2105 cells/ml. target prediction Bioinformatic analysis was conducted using TargetScan and miRanda. regions of the human MMP-11 gene containing putative miR-192 binding sites were amplified from human genomic DNA by RT-PCR. membrane was blocked for 0.5 h in 5% skimmed milk, followed by incubation with primary antibodies (1:300; Ruiqi Biotechnology, Shanghai, China) after washing three times with TBST (5 min each), the membranes were incubated with a 1:2,500 dilution of goat anti-mouse IgG. cDNA was synthesized using the TRIzol reagent kit (Thermo Fisher Scientific, Inc.) RT-qPCR was performed using SYBR-Green Premix Ex Taq (Takara Bio, Inc.) human osteoblast hFOB1.19 cells were cultured in Dulbecco's modified Eagle's medium supplemented with 10% FBS (Gibco; Thermo Fisher Scientific, Inc.), 100 U/ml penicillin and 100 g/ml streptomycin at 37°C in a 5% CO2 humidified atmosphere. transfection of miRNA MG-63 cells was seeded into each well of a 6-well plate (2105 cells/well) and the cells from each group were harvested 36-h post-transfection by trypsinization. the cells were seeded into 96-well plates at a total density of 2106 cells/well in a mixed Ac-DEVD-PNA buffer. on the following day, absorbance values were measured at 415 nm. micrographs of the same position relative to the wound were taken at 0 and 36 h. each assay was performed in triplicate. target prediction Bioinformatic analysis was conducted using TargetScan and miRanda. amide gels followed by transfer to polyvinylidene difluoride membranes. membrane was blocked for 0.5 h at room temperature in 5% skimmed milk. incubation with primary antibodies (1:300; Ruiqi Biotechnology, Shanghai, China) at 4°C overnight. cDNA was synthesized using the TRIzol reagent kit (Thermo Fisher Scientific, Inc.) RT-qPCR was performed using the TRIzol reagent (Invitrogen; Thermo Fisher Scientific, Inc.) cDNA was synthesized using the RevertAid First Strand cDNA kit. human osteoblast hFOB1.19 cells were cultured in modified Eagle's medium. transfection of miRNA MG-63 cells was seeded into each well of a 6-well plate. the cells were then transfected with either miR-192 agomir or negative control (NC) or miR-192 antagomir or NC (Shanghai GenePharma Co., Ltd., Shanghai, China) the cells from each group were harvested 36-h post-transfection by trypsinization. the cells were seeded into 96-well plates at a total density of 2106 cells/well in a mixed Ac-DEVD-PNA buffer. on the following day, absorbance values were measured at 415 nm. micrographs of the same position relative to the wound were taken at 0 and 36 h. each assay was performed in triplicate. target prediction Bioinformatic analysis was conducted using TargetScan. proteins were loaded for SDS-PAGE on 10% polyacrylamide gels. membrane was blocked for 0.5 h at room temperature in 5% skimmed milk. incubation with primary antibodies (1:300; Ruiqi Biotechnology, Shanghai, China) levels of MMP-11 mRNA were higher in OS tissues compared with adjacent non-tumor tissues (P0.05; Fig. 1A) compared with matched adjacent non-tumor tissues, the level of miR-192 expression in MG63 cells was lower compared with hFOB1.19 cells. inverse correlation between miR-192 and MMP-11 expression levels in OS tissues and matched adjacent non-tumor tissues. miR-192 agomir inhibits proliferation and induces apoptosis in MG63 cells. miR-192 expression was detected after 36 h. RT-qPCR analysis revealed that miR-192 expression was increased by transfection of miR-192 agomir. miR-192 antagomir was able to significantly block apoptosis in MG63 cells. miR-192 downregulation increases proliferation and suppresses apoptosis in MG63 cells. miR-192 agomir and antagomir modulate the migration and invasion of MG63 cells. the miR-192 agomir or NC and miR-192 antagomir or NC were transfected into MG63 cells. ds containing the 3′-UTR of MMP-11 with either a wild-type or mutant putative miR-192 binding site were constructed. the relative luciferase activity of the construct was significantly downregulated compared with the mutant MMP-11 3′-UTR. levels of miR-192 and MMP-11 expression were detected by RT-qPCR in human OS tissues and cell lines. miR-192 expression was significantly downregulated in OS tissues compared with matched adjacent non-tumor tissues. miR-192 expression was downregulated in OS tissues compared with matched normal adjacent tissues. miR-192 expression was suppressed in MG63 cells compared with hFOB1.19 cells. MMP-11 expression was increased in MG63 cells compared with hFOB1.19 cells. western blotting was performed to detect levels of MMP-11 protein in OS tissues. miR-192 agomir was transfected into MG63 cells. downregulation of miR-192 promotes proliferation and suppresses apoptosis in MG63 cells. miR-192 agomir and antagomir modulate migration and invasion of MG63 cells. migrated cells in each field were counted and analyzed. miRNA, microRNA; NC, negative control. target genes of miR-192 were searched using target prediction programs. results showed that MMP-11 was a potential miR-192 target gene. non-transfected cells, NC, cells that were transfected with a scrambled miR-192 sequence, agomir and antagomir. the transfection of miR-192 agomir resulted in a decrease in MMP-11 protein levels. western blotting showed that MMP-11 protein levels were upregulated in OS tissues compared with adjacent non-tumor tissues. miR-192 expression was downregulated in OS tissues compared with matched adjacent non-tumor tissues. miR-192 agomir was transfected into MG63 cells. miR-192 expression was sharply decreased by miR-192 antagomir transfection. RT-qPCR analysis revealed that miR-192 expression was increased by transfection of miR-192 agomir compared with the control group. miR-192 downregulation increases proliferation and suppresses apoptosis in MG63 cells. apoptosis was detected by caspase-3 assay following transfection in MG63 cells. miR-192 agomir or NC and miR-192 antagomir or NC were transfected into MG63 cells. effect of miR-192 on migration of MG63 cells as assessed by wound-healing assay. miR-192 suppresses MMP-11 expression by directly targeting its 3′-UTR of MMP-11 mRNA. miR-192 antagomir upregulated the levels of MMP-11 protein. miRNAs are small non-coding RNA molecules ranging from 17 to 22 bp (26) that function in mRNA silencing and the post-transcriptional regulation of gene expression. each miRNA can control hundreds of gene targets, indicating that miRNAs may function as tumor suppressors or oncogenes via cellular pathways. the overexpression of miR-192 was able to decrease proliferation and promote apoptosis in MG63 cells. the overexpression of miR-192 inhibits the progression and invasion of OS by downregulating MMP-11 expression via directly targeting its 3′UTR. the present study is the first to demonstrate the crosstalk between miR-192 and MMP-11 in OS. our findings suggest that miR-192 is downregulated in OS. both miR-192 and MMP-11 could be promising candidate targets.
